example: مَرْحَبًا، كَيْفَ حَالُكَ؟ (marhaba, kayfa haluka?) - Hello, how are you?
مَرْحَبًا بِكُمْ فِي بَيْتِي. (marhaba bikum fi bayti) - Welcome to my home.
مَرْحَبًا أَيُّهَا الأَصْدِقَاء. (marhaba ayuha al-asdiqaa') - Hello, friends.
مَرْحَبًا، أَنَا سَعِيدٌ بِلِقَائِكَ. (marhaba, ana sa'eed biliqa'ik) - Hello, I am happy to meet you.
شُكْرًا عَلَى المَسَاعَدَةِ. (shukran ala al-musa'adah) - Thank you for the help.
شُكْرًا لِحُضُورِك. (shukran lihudhurik) - Thank you for coming.
شُكْرًا جَزِيلًا. (shukran jazeelan) - Thank you very much.
أَقُولُ شُكْرًا بَعْدَ كُلِّ خِدْمَة. (aqulu shukran ba'da kulli khidmah) - I say thank you after every service.
نَعَمْ، أَنَا أُحِبُّ الْقَهْوَةَ. (na'am, ana uhibbu al-qahwah) - Yes, I love coffee.
نَعَمْ، هَذَا صَحِيحٌ. (na'am, hatha saheeh) - Yes, that is correct.
نَعَمْ، أَنَا فِي الطَّرِيقِ. (na'am, ana fi al-tareeq) - Yes, I am on my way.
نَعَمْ، أُرِيدُ هَذَا. (na'am, ureedu hatha) - Yes, I want this.
لَا، أَنَا لَا أُرِيدُ. (la, ana la ureedu) - No, I don't want it.
لَا، هَذَا غَيْرُ مُمْكِنٍ. (la, hatha ghayru mumkin) - No, this is not possible.
لَا، لَيْسَ لَدَيَّ وَقْتٌ. (la, laysa ladayya waqt) - No, I don't have time.
لَا، أَنَا أَفْضِلُ شَيْئًا آخَرَ. (la, ana afaddil shay'an akhar) - No, I prefer something else.

when_to_say: When referring to a male friend
example: هَذَا صَدِيقِي. (hatha sadeeqi) - This is my friend.
لَدَيَّ صَدِيقٌ جَيِّدٌ. (ladayya sadeequn jayyid) - I have a good friend.
صَدِيقِي يُحِبُّ الرِّيَاضَةَ. (sadeeqi yuhibbu al-riyadah) - My friend loves sports.
لَدَيْنَا نَفْسُ الهِوَايَةِ، صَدِيقِي. (ladayna nafsu al-hawayah, sadeeqi) - My friend and I share the same hobby.

when_to_say: When referring to a female friend
example: هِيَ صَدِيقَتِي. (hiya sadeeqati) - She is my friend.
لَدَيَّ صَدِيقَةٌ طَيِّبَةٌ. (ladayya sadeeqatun tayyibah) - I have a kind friend.
صَدِيقَتِي تُحِبُّ القِرَاءَةَ. (sadeeqati tuhibbu al-qira'ah) - My friend loves reading.
نَخْرُجُ أَنَا وَصَدِيقَتِي كُلَّ نِهَايَةِ أُسْبُوعٍ. (nakhruju ana wa sadeeqati kulla nihayati usboo') - My friend and I go out every weekend.

when_to_say: When referring to meals or eating
example: أُحِبُّ الطَّعَامَ العَرَبِيَّ. (uhibbu al-ta'am al-arabi) - I love Arabic food.
هَذَا الطَّعَامُ لَذِيذٌ. (hatha al-ta'am laziz) - This food is delicious.
نَتَنَاوَلُ الطَّعَامَ فِي المَطْعَمِ. (natanaawalu al-ta'am fi al-mat'am) - We eat food at the restaurant.
أَيْنَ يُوجَدُ الطَّعَامُ؟ (ayna yujadu al-ta'am?) - Where is the food?

when_to_say: When asking for or offering water
example: أُرِيدُ كُوبَ مَاءٍ. (ureedu koob maa') - I want a glass of water.
المَاءُ صَافٍ. (al-maa'u saaf) - The water is clear.
أَشْرَبُ مَاءً كَثِيرًا. (ashrabu ma'an katheeran) - I drink a lot of water.
هَلْ هُنَاكَ مَاءٌ بَارِدٌ؟ (hal hunaka maa'un bared?) - Is there cold water?

when_to_say: When referring to reading or books
example: أَيْنَ الكِتَابُ؟ (ayna al-kitaab?) - Where is the book?
أَقْرَأُ كِتَابًا كُلَّ يَوْمٍ. (aqra'u kitaaban kulla yawm) - I read a book every day.
هَذَا كِتَابِي. (hatha kitaabi) - This is my book.
هَلْ لَدَيْكَ كِتَابٌ جَدِيدٌ؟ (hal ladayka kitaabun jadeed?) - Do you have a new book?
أَنَا أَذْهَبُ إِلَى المَدْرَسَةِ. (ana adhhab ila al-madrasah) - I go to school.
المَدْرَسَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-madrasah kabeerah) - The school is big.
نَتَعَلَّمُ الكَثِيرَ فِي المَدْرَسَةِ. (nata'allamu al-katheer fi al-madrasah) - We learn a lot in school.
مَتَى تَبْدَأُ المَدْرَسَةُ؟ (mata tabda'u al-madrasah?) - When does the school start?

when_to_say: To describe something or someone attractive
example: المَنْظَرُ جَمِيلٌ. (al-manzar jameel) - The view is beautiful.
هَذِهِ زَهْرَةٌ جَمِيلَةٌ. (hathihi zahrah jameelah) - This is a beautiful flower.
البِنَايَةُ جَمِيلَةٌ. (al-binaayah jameelah) - The building is beautiful.
لَدَيْكَ خَطٌّ جَمِيلٌ. (ladayka khat jameel) - You have beautiful handwriting.
أَنَا سَعِيدٌ جِدًّا. (ana sa'eed jiddan) - I am very happy.
هُوَ سَعِيدٌ بِالنَّتِيجَةِ. (huwa sa'eed bil-nateejah) - He is happy with the result.
نَحْنُ سُعَدَاءُ بِاللِّقَاءِ. (nahnu su'adaa' bil-liqaa') - We are happy to meet.
لَدَيْهِ أَخْبَارٌ تُسْعِدُنِي. (ladayhi akhbaar tus'iduni) - He has news that makes me happy.
هَذَا بَيْتِي. (hatha bayti) - This is my house.
أَبْحَثُ عَنْ بَيْتٍ جَدِيدٍ. (abhathu an baytin jadeed) - I am looking for a new house.
البَيْتُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-bayt kabeer) - The house is big.
أُحِبُّ قَضَاءَ الوَقْتِ فِي البَيْتِ. (uhibbu qadaa' al-waqt fi al-bayt) - I love spending time at home.

when_to_say: To refer to a medical professional
example: أَحْتَاجُ إِلَى طَبِيبٍ. (ahtaaju ila tabeeb) - I need a doctor.
الطَبِيبُ يَعْمَلُ فِي المَسْتَشْفَى. (al-tabeeb ya'mal fi al-mustashfa) - The doctor works in the hospital.
الطَبِيبُ قَدَّمَ النَّصِيحَةَ. (al-tabeeb qaddama al-naseehah) - The doctor gave advice.
هَلْ لَدَيْكَ مَوْعِدٌ مَعَ الطَبِيبِ؟ (hal ladayka maw'id ma'a al-tabeeb?) - Do you have an appointment with the doctor?

when_to_say: When referring to vehicles or transport
example: لَدَيَّ سَيَّارَةٌ جَدِيدَةٌ. (ladayya sayyarah jadeedah) - I have a new car.
هَذِهِ سَيَّارَةٌ سَرِيعَةٌ. (hathihi sayyarah saree'ah) - This is a fast car.
سَيَّارَتِي فِي الكَرَاجِ. (sayyarati fi al-karaj) - My car is in the garage.
أُفَضِّلُ السَّيَّارَةَ عَنْ الحَافِلَةِ. (ufaddil al-sayyarah an al-hafilah) - I prefer the car over the bus.
هَذَا قَلَمِي. (hatha qalami) - This is my pen.
أُرِيدُ قَلَمًا أَزْرَقَ. (ureedu qalaman azraq) - I want a blue pen.
هَلْ عِنْدَكَ قَلَمٌ؟ (hal indaka qalam?) - Do you have a pen?
القَلَمُ عَلَى المَكْتَبِ. (al-qalam ala al-maktab) - The pen is on the desk.

when_to_say: When discussing the sky or night
example: القَمَرُ جَمِيلٌ اللَّيْلَةَ. (al-qamar jameel al-laylah) - The moon is beautiful tonight.
أُشَاهِدُ القَمَرَ كُلَّ لَيْلَةٍ. (ushahidu al-qamar kulla laylah) - I watch the moon every night.
القَمَرُ مَصْدَرُ ضَوْءٍ لَيْلِيٍّ. (al-qamar masdar daw' layli) - The moon is a source of night light.
هَلْ رَأَيْتَ قَمَرًا بَدْرًا؟ (hal ra'ayta qamaran badran?) - Have you seen a full moon?

when_to_say: When referring to the day or weather
example: الشَّمْسُ تُضِيءُ النَّهَارَ. (al-shams tudeeu al-nahar) - The sun lights the day.
الشَّمْسُ سَاطِعَةٌ اليَوْمَ. (al-shams saati'ah al-yawm) - The sun is shining today.
أُحِبُّ المَشْيَ تَحْتَ الشَّمْسِ. (uhibbu al-mashya tahta al-shams) - I love walking under the sun.
الشَّمْسُ تُحْرِقُ البَشَرَةَ أَحْيَانًا. (al-shams tuhriqu al-bashara ahyanan) - The sun sometimes burns the skin.
أُرِيدُ وَرَقَةً لِلْكِتَابَةِ. (ureedu waraqatan lil-kitabah) - I need a paper for writing.
هَذِهِ وَرَقَةٌ صَفْرَاءُ. (hathihi waraqah safra') - This is a yellow paper.
الوَرَقَةُ عَلَى الطَّاوِلَةِ. (al-waraqah ala al-tawilah) - The paper is on the table.
هَلْ هَذِهِ وَرَقَتُكَ؟ (hal hathihi waraqatuka?) - Is this your paper?

when_to_say: When discussing colors or describing things
example: مَا لَوْنُ سَيَّارَتِكَ؟ (ma lawn sayyaratik?) - What is the color of your car?
اللَّوْنُ الأَحْمَرُ جَمِيلٌ. (al-lawn al-ahmar jameel) - The red color is beautiful.
تُحِبُّ أُخْتِي الأَلْوَانَ الزَّاهِيَةَ. (tuhibbu ukhti al-alwan al-zahiyah) - My sister loves bright colors.
لَوْنُ المَاءِ شَفَّافٌ. (lawn al-maa' shaffaf) - The color of water is transparent.

when_to_say: When referring to a young boy
example: هَذَا طِفْلٌ صَغِيرٌ. (hatha tifl sagheer) - This is a small child.
الطِّفْلُ يَبْكِي. (al-tifl yabki) - The child is crying.
أُحِبُّ اللَّعِبَ مَعَ الطِّفْلِ. (uhibbu al-la'ib ma'a al-tifl) - I love playing with the child.
الطِّفْلُ يَذْهَبُ إِلَى المَدْرَسَةِ. (al-tifl yadhhab ila al-madrasah) - The child goes to school.
هَذَا بَيْتٌ كَبِيرٌ. (hatha bayt kabeer) - This is a big house.
القِطَّةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-qittah kabeerah) - The cat is big.
لَدَيْنَا مُشْكِلَةٌ كَبِيرَةٌ. (ladayna mushkilah kabeerah) - We have a big problem.
هَذِهِ حَقِيبَةٌ كَبِيرَةٌ. (hathihi haqeebah kabeerah) - This is a big bag.
هَذَا كُرْسِيٌّ صَغِيرٌ. (hatha kursi sagheer) - This is a small chair.
القَلَمُ صَغِيرٌ. (al-qalam sagheer) - The pen is small.
لَدَيْنَا مُشْكِلَةٌ صَغِيرَةٌ. (ladayna mushkilah sagheerah) - We have a small problem.
هَذِهِ قِطَّةٌ صَغِيرَةٌ. (hathihi qittah sagheerah) - This is a small cat.

when_to_say: When referring to luggage or school bags
example: حَقِيبَتِي فِي الغُرْفَةِ. (haqeebati fi al-ghurfah) - My bag is in the room.
هَلْ هَذِهِ حَقِيبَتُكَ؟ (hal hathihi haqeebatuka?) - Is this your bag?
الحَقِيبَةُ ثَقِيلَةٌ. (al-haqeebah thaqeelah) - The bag is heavy.
أَضَعُ كُتُبِي فِي الحَقِيبَةِ. (adha'u kutubi fi al-haqeebah) - I put my books in the bag.
أَسَافِرُ بِالطَّائِرَةِ. (asafiru bil-ta'irah) - I travel by airplane.
هَلْ هَذِهِ طَائِرَتُكَ؟ (hal hathihi ta'iratuka?) - Is this your airplane?
الطَّائِرَةُ فِي السَّمَاءِ. (al-ta'irah fi al-sama') - The airplane is in the sky.
أَحْبَبْتُ الرِّحْلَةَ بِالطَّائِرَةِ. (ahbabtu al-rihlah bil-ta'irah) - I enjoyed the airplane trip.
لَدَيَّ كِتَابٌ جَدِيدٌ. (ladayya kitaab jadeed) - I have a new book.
هَذَا كِتَابِي. (hatha kitabi) - This is my book.
هَلْ قَرَأْتَ الكِتَابَ؟ (hal qara'ta al-kitaab?) - Did you read the book?
الكِتَابُ عَلَى الطَّاوِلَةِ. (al-kitaab ala al-tawilah) - The book is on the table.
الطِّفْلُ فِي المَدْرَسَةِ. (al-tifl fi al-madrasah) - The child is in the school.
مَدْرَسَتِي كَبِيرَةٌ. (madrasati kabeerah) - My school is big.
هَلْ تُحِبُّ المَدْرَسَةَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-madrasah?) - Do you like school?
المَدْرَسَةُ بَعِيدَةٌ. (al-madrasah ba'eedah) - The school is far.
السَّمَاءُ زَرْقَاءُ. (al-sama' zarqa') - The sky is blue.
نَظَرْتُ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ. (nazartu ila al-sama') - I looked at the sky.
السَّمَاءُ صَافِيَةٌ اليَوْمَ. (al-sama' safiyah al-yawm) - The sky is clear today.
رَأَيْتُ طَائِرَةً فِي السَّمَاءِ. (ra'aytu ta'irah fi al-sama') - I saw an airplane in the sky.
النَّجْمُ يَلْمَعُ فِي السَّمَاءِ. (al-najm yalma' fi al-sama') - The star shines in the sky.
رَأَيْتُ نَجْمًا كَبِيرًا. (ra'aytu najman kabeeran) - I saw a big star.
هَلْ تَعْرِفُ النُّجُومَ؟ (hal ta'rifu al-nujoom?) - Do you know the stars?
النُّجُومُ جَمِيلَةٌ فِي اللَّيْلِ. (al-nujoom jameelah fi al-layl) - The stars are beautiful at night.

when_to_say: When talking about drinks or nature
example: أُرِيدُ كَأْسًا مِنَ المَاءِ. (ureedu ka'san min al-maa') - I want a glass of water.
المَاءُ بَارِدٌ. (al-maa' barid) - The water is cold.
لَا تَنْسَى شُرْبَ المَاءِ. (laa tansa shurb al-maa') - Don't forget to drink water.
المَاءُ حَيَاةٌ. (al-maa' hayat) - Water is life.

when_to_say: When talking about homes or shelter
example: هَذَا بَيْتِي. (hatha bayti) - This is my house.
البَيْتُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-bayt kabeer) - The house is big.
أُحِبُّ البَيْتَ. (uhibbu al-bayt) - I love the house.
هَلْ زُرْتَ البَيْتَ؟ (hal zurta al-bayt?) - Did you visit the house?

when_to_say: When referring to entrances or exits
example: فَتَحْتُ البَابَ. (fatahtu al-baab) - I opened the door.
هَلْ أَغْلَقْتَ البَابَ؟ (hal aghlaqta al-baab?) - Did you close the door?
البَابُ مَفْتُوحٌ. (al-baab maftooh) - The door is open.
أُغْلِقُ البَابَ فِي اللَّيْلِ. (ughliqu al-baab fi al-layl) - I close the door at night.
هَذَا كُرْسِيٌّ جَمِيلٌ. (hatha kursi jameel) - This is a beautiful chair.
اجْلِسْ عَلَى الكُرْسِيِّ. (ijlis ala al-kursi) - Sit on the chair.
الكُرْسِيُّ مَكْسُورٌ. (al-kursi maksoor) - The chair is broken.
هَلْ هَذَا كُرْسِيُّكَ؟ (hal hatha kursiyuka?) - Is this your chair?
هَذِهِ طَاوِلَةٌ جَدِيدَةٌ. (hathihi tawilah jadeedah) - This is a new table.
الطَّاوِلَةُ فِي الغُرْفَةِ. (al-tawilah fi al-ghurfah) - The table is in the room.
أُحِبُّ الطَّاوِلَةَ الكَبِيرَةَ. (uhibbu al-tawilah al-kabeerah) - I love the big table.
هَلْ وُضِعَ الطَّعَامُ عَلَى الطَّاوِلَةِ؟ (hal wudi'a al-ta'am ala al-tawilah?) - Was the food placed on the table?
الشَّمْسُ سَاطِعَةٌ. (al-shams saati'ah) - The sun is shining.
رَأَيْتُ الشَّمْسَ فِي الصَّبَاحِ. (ra'aytu al-shams fi al-sabah) - I saw the sun in the morning.
هَلْ تُحِبُّ الشَّمْسَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-shams?) - Do you like the sun?
الشَّمْسُ دَافِئَةٌ اليَوْمَ. (al-shams dafi'ah al-yawm) - The sun is warm today.
رَأَيْتُ جَبَلًا عَالِيًا. (ra'aytu jabal-an 'aaleeyan) - I saw a tall mountain.
الجَبَلُ مغطى بالثلج. (al-jabal mughataa balthalj) - The mountain is covered with snow.
نَحْنُ نَتَسَلَّقُ الجَبَلَ. (nahnu natasallaqu al-jabal) - We are climbing the mountain.
الجَبَلُ جَمِيلٌ فِي الصَّبَاحِ. (al-jabal jameel fi al-sabah) - The mountain is beautiful in the morning.
لَدَيَّ سَيَّارَةٌ جَدِيدَةٌ. (ladayya sayyarah jadeedah) - I have a new car.
السَّيَّارَةُ سَرِيعَةٌ. (al-sayyarah saree'ah) - The car is fast.
هلَ تَمْلِكُ سَيَّارَةً؟ (hal tamliku sayyara?) - Do you own a car?
السَّيَّارَةُ فِي المَرْكَزِ. (al-sayyarah fi al-markaz) - The car is in the garage.

when_to_say: When talking about emotions or anatomy
example: قَلْبُهُ صَحِيحٌ. (qalbuhu saheeh) - His heart is healthy.
أَحِبُّكِ مِنْ قَلْبِي. (uhibbuki min qalbi) - I love you from my heart.
قَلْبُ الإِنسَانِ حَسَّاسٌ. (qalb al-insani hassas) - The human heart is sensitive.
يَشْعُرُ قَلْبِي بِالسَّعَادَةِ. (yash'uru qalbi bi al-sa'adah) - My heart feels happy.
مُدَرِّسِي جَامِلٌ. (mudarrisi jaameel) - My teacher is kind.
المُدَرِّسُ فِي الفَصْلِ. (al-mudarris fi al-fasl) - The teacher is in the classroom.
هَلْ أَنتَ مُدَرِّسٌ؟ (hal anta mudarris?) - Are you a teacher?
أَحْبُّ المُدَرِّسِينَ. (uhibbu al-mudarriseen) - I love teachers.

when_to_say: When talking about meals or dishes
example: أُحِبُّ الطَّعَامَ الحَارِ. (uhibbu al-ta'ama al-haaree) - I love spicy food.
الطَّعَامُ لَذِيذٌ. (al-ta'amu latheez) - The food is delicious.
هلْ تَحِبُّ الطَّعَامَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-ta'ama?) - Do you like food?
أَكَلْتُ الطَّعَامَ فِي المَطْعَمِ. (akaltu al-ta'ama fi al-mat'ama) - I ate food at the restaurant.

when_to_say: When talking about food or health
example: أُحِبُّ الفَاكِهَةَ. (uhibbu al-faakehah) - I love fruit.
الفَاكِهَةُ لَذِيذَةٌ. (al-faakehah latheezah) - The fruit is delicious.
هَلْ تَأْكُلُ الفَاكِهَةَ؟ (hal ta'kulu al-faakehah?) - Do you eat fruit?
أَحْضَرْتُ الفَاكِهَةَ. (ahdartu al-faakehah) - I brought the fruit.
السَّيَّارَةُ تَذْهَبُ إِلَى المَطَارِ. (al-sayyarah tadhhabu ila al-matar) - The car is going to the airport.
المَطَارُ جَامِعٌ. (al-matar jaame'a) - The airport is crowded.
هَلْ رَأَيْتَ المَطَارَ؟ (hal ra'ayta al-matar?) - Did you see the airport?
المَطَارُ بَعِيدٌ عَنِ المَدِينَةِ. (al-matar ba'eed 'ani al-madienah) - The airport is far from the city.

when_to_say: When talking about sports or events
example: نَحْنُ فِي المَلْعَبِ. (nahnu fi al-mal'ab) - We are in the stadium.
المَلْعَبُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-mal'ab kabeer) - The stadium is big.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ السُّودَةَ فِي المَلْعَبِ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-soodah fi al-mal'ab?) - Do you like the game in the stadium?
المَلْعَبُ مَمْلُوءٌ بِالْمُشَجِّعِينَ. (al-mal'ab mamloo' bil-mushaj'ieen) - The stadium is full of spectators.

when_to_say: When talking about cycling or transportation
example: لَدَيَّ دَرَّاجَةٌ جَدِيدَةٌ. (ladayya darraajah jadeedah) - I have a new bicycle.
دَرَّاجَتِي فِي الحَديقةِ. (darraajati fi al-hadeeqah) - My bicycle is in the garden.
هَلْ تَرْكَبُ الدَرَّاجَةَ؟ (hal tarkabu al-darrajah?) - Do you ride the bicycle?
الدَرَّاجَةُ سَريعةٌ. (al-darraajah saree'ah) - The bicycle is fast.
اِسْتَعْمَلْتُ حَاسُوبِي. (ista'maltu hasoobi) - I used my computer.
الحَاسُوبُ فِي الغُرْفَةِ. (al-hasoob fi al-ghurfah) - The computer is in the room.
هَلْ تَعْرِفُ حَاسُوبًا؟ (hal ta'rifu hasooban?) - Do you know a computer?
حَاسُوبِي جَديدٌ. (hasoobi jadeed) - My computer is new.

when_to_say: When talking about the night sky or celestial objects
example: القَمَرُ سَاطِعٌ. (al-qamar saati'ah) - The moon is shining.
رَأَيْتُ القَمَرَ فِي اللَّيْلِ. (ra'aytu al-qamara fi al-layl) - I saw the moon at night.
القَمَرُ جَمِيلٌ فِي اللَّيْلِ. (al-qamar jameel fi al-layl) - The moon is beautiful at night.
الْقَمَرُ فِي السَّمَاءِ. (al-qamar fi al-sama') - The moon is in the sky.
أَنَا فِي المَدِينَةِ. (ana fi al-madeenah) - I am in the city.
المَدِينَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-madeenah kabeerah) - The city is big.
هَلْ زُرْتَ المَدِينَةَ؟ (hal zurta al-madeenah?) - Did you visit the city?
المَدِينَةُ جَمِيلَةٌ فِي الصَّيفِ. (al-madeenah jameelah fi al-saif) - The city is beautiful in summer.

when_to_say: When talking about reading or education
example: أَنَا أَقْرَأُ كِتَابًا. (ana aqra'u kitaaban) - I am reading a book.
الْكِتَابُ جَمِيلٌ. (al-kitaabu jameel) - The book is beautiful.
هَلْ قَرَأْتَ هَذَا الكِتَابَ؟ (hal qara'ta hatha al-kitaab?) - Did you read this book?
أَحْضَرْتُ كِتَابًا جَدِيدًا. (ahdartu kitaaban jadeedan) - I brought a new book.
الشَّجَرَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-shajarah kabeerah) - The tree is big.
رَأَيْتُ شَجَرَةً جَمِيلَةً. (ra'aytu shajaratan jameelatan) - I saw a beautiful tree.
الشَّجَرَةُ مَخْضَرَةٌ. (al-shajarah makhdarah) - The tree is green.
تَحْتَ الشَّجَرَةِ. (tahta al-shajarah) - Under the tree.
مَرْحَبًا! (marhaban) - Hello!
مَرْحَبًا بِكَ. (marhaban bika) - Welcome to you.
مَرْحَبًا فِي بَيْتِي. (marhaban fi bayti) - Welcome to my house.
مَرْحَبًا صَدِيقِي. (marhaban sadiqi) - Hello, my friend.
أَنَا فِي الجَامِعَةِ. (ana fi al-jaami'ah) - I am in the university.
الجَامِعَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-jaami'ah kabeerah) - The university is big.
هَلْ تَدْرُسُ فِي الجَامِعَةِ؟ (hal tadrusu fi al-jaami'ah?) - Do you study in the university?
يَحْتَاجُ إِلَى الجَامِعَةِ. (yahtaaju ila al-jaami'ah) - He needs to go to the university.

when_to_say: When referring to someone cherished or loved
example: أَنتَ حَبِيبِي. (anta habeebi) - You are my beloved.
هِيَ حَبِيبَتِي. (hiya habeebati) - She is my dear.
لَدَيَّ حَبِيبٌ جَدِيدٌ. (ladayya habeebun jadeed) - I have a new beloved.
حَبِيبِي فِي القَلْبِ. (habeebi fi al-qalb) - My beloved is in my heart.

when_to_say: When talking about Islamic places of worship
example: أَنَا فِي المَسْجِدِ. (ana fi al-masjid) - I am in the mosque.
المَسْجِدُ جَمِيلٌ. (al-masjidu jameel) - The mosque is beautiful.
الْمَسْجِدُ فِي الحَيِّ. (al-masjidu fi al-hayy) - The mosque is in the neighborhood.
يُصَلِّي فِي المَسْجِدِ. (yusallee fi al-masjid) - He prays in the mosque.

when_to_say: When talking about the seaside or vacation spots
example: نَحْنُ نَذْهَبُ إِلَى الشَّاطِئِ. (nahnu nadhhabu ila al-shaati) - We are going to the beach.
الشَّاطِئُ جَمِيلٌ. (al-shaati'u jameel) - The beach is beautiful.
أَحِبُّ السَّباحَةَ فِي الشَّاطِئِ. (uhibbu as-sabaahata fi al-shaati) - I love swimming at the beach.
الشَّاطِئُ هَادِئٌ. (al-shaati'u haadee') - The beach is calm.
أَنا حَامِلٌ حَقِيبَةً. (ana haamilun haqee'batan) - I am carrying a bag.
الحَقِيبَةُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-haqeebah jameel) - The bag is beautiful.
حَقِيبَتِي ضَائِعَةٌ. (haqeebatee daa'i'ah) - My bag is lost.
أَضَعُ كِتَابًا فِي حَقِيبَتِي. (ada'u kitaaban fi haqee'bati) - I put a book in my bag.

when_to_say: When talking about understanding or education
example: لَدَيَّ مَعْرِفَةٌ جَزْئِيَّةٌ. (ladayya ma'rifah jazeeyah) - I have partial knowledge.
المَعْرِفَةُ قُوَّةٌ. (al-ma'rifah quwwah) - Knowledge is power.
هَلْ تَمْتَلِكُ مَعْرِفَةً؟ (hal tamtaliku ma'rifah?) - Do you have knowledge?
أَنَا فِي مَعْرِفَتِي. (ana fi ma'rifatee) - I am in my knowledge.

when_to_say: When talking about writing or stationery
example: اِسْتَعْمَلْتُ قَلَمًا. (ista'maltu qalam) - I used a pen.
القَلَمُ أَزْرَقُ. (al-qalamu azraq) - The pen is blue.
أَحْضَرْتُ قَلَمًا جَدِيدًا. (ahdartu qalamaan jadeedaan) - I brought a new pen.
أَنَا أَكْتُبُ بِقَلَمٍ. (ana aktubu biqalam) - I am writing with a pen.

when_to_say: When referring to someone in education
example: هُوَ تِلْمِيدٌ فِي مَدْرَسَةٍ. (huwa tilmeedun fi madrasa) - He is a student in school.
التِّلْمِيدُ جَادٌّ. (at-tilmeedu jaad) - The student is serious.
أَنَا تِلْمِيدٌ فِي المَدْرَسَةِ. (ana tilmeedun fi al-madrasa) - I am a student at the school.
التِّلْمِيدُ يَقْرَأُ دَرْسَةً. (at-tilmeedu yaqra'u darsatan) - The student is reading a lesson.

when_to_say: When talking about media or news
example: أَنَا أَقْرَأُ الصَّحِيفَةَ. (ana aqra'u as-saheefah) - I read the newspaper.
الصَّحِيفَةُ فِي المَكْتَبَةِ. (as-saheefah fi al-maktabah) - The newspaper is in the library.
هَلْ قَرَأْتَ الصَّحِيفَةَ؟ (hal qara'ta as-saheefah?) - Did you read the newspaper?
الصَّحِيفَةُ تَحْتَ الطَّاوِلَةِ. (as-saheefah tahta at-taawilah) - The newspaper is under the table.
أَنَا مُدَرِّسٌ. (ana mudarris) - I am a teacher.
المُدَرِّسُ جَادٌّ. (al-mudarris jaad) - The teacher is serious.
الْمُدَرِّسُ فِي فَصْلٍ. (al-mudarris fi faslin) - The teacher is in the classroom.
يُحِبُّ التَّعْلِيمَ. (yuhibbu at-ta'leem) - He loves teaching.

when_to_say: When talking about a library or books
example: أَنَا فِي المَكْتَبَةِ. (ana fi al-maktabah) - I am in the library.
المَكْتَبَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-maktabah kabeerah) - The library is big.
هَلْ زُرْتَ المَكْتَبَةَ؟ (hal zurta al-maktabah?) - Did you visit the library?
أُحِبُّ قِرَاءَةَ الكُتُبِ فِي المَكْتَبَةِ. (uhibbu qira'at al-kutub fi al-maktabah) - I love reading books in the library.
الطَّائِرُ يَطِيرُ فِي السَّمَاءِ. (at-ta'iru yateeru fi as-sama') - The bird is flying in the sky.
رَأَيْتُ طَائِرًا جَمِيلًا. (ra'aytu ta'iran jameelan) - I saw a beautiful bird.
الطَّائِرُ صَغِيرٌ. (at-ta'iru sagheer) - The bird is small.
الطَّائِرُ يَأْكُلُ الحَبَّ. (at-ta'iru ya'kulu al-habb) - The bird is eating seeds.

when_to_say: When talking about food or eating
example: أُحِبُّ الفَاكِهَةَ. (uhibbu al-faakehah) - I love fruit.
الْفَاكِهَةُ لَذِيذَةٌ. (al-faakehatu latheezah) - The fruit is delicious.
فَاكِهَتِي المفضَّلةُ التُّفَّاحُ. (faakehatee al-mufaddalah at-toofah) - My favorite fruit is the apple.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الفَاكِهَةَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-faakehah?) - Do you like fruit?

when_to_say: When talking about liquids or thirst
example: أَنَا أَشْرَبُ مَاءً. (ana ashrabu ma'an) - I am drinking water.
المَاءُ بَارِدٌ. (al-maa'u baarid) - The water is cold.
هَلْ تَشْرَبُ مَاءً؟ (hal tashrabu ma'an?) - Do you drink water?
المَاءُ نَظِيفٌ. (al-maa'u nazeef) - The water is clean.
الْسَّاعَةُ تَجُولُ. (as-saa'atu tajuulu) - The clock is ticking.
هَلْ تَعْرِفُ السَّاعَةَ؟ (hal ta'rifu as-saa'ah?) - Do you know the time?
السَّاعَةُ مَجَانِيَّةٌ. (as-saa'atu majaniyyah) - The hour is free.
السَّاعَةُ السَّابِعَةُ. (as-saa'atu as-saabi'ah) - It is seven o'clock.

when_to_say: When talking about a male person
example: هُوَ رَجُلٌ طَيِّبٌ. (huwa rajulun tayyib) - He is a good man.
الرَّجُلُ قَوِيٌّ. (ar-rajulu qawee) - The man is strong.
الرَّجُلُ يَعْمَلُ فِي المَصْنَعِ. (ar-rajulu ya'malu fi al-masna') - The man works in the factory.
هَلْ تَعْرِفُ هَذَا الرَّجُلَ؟ (hal ta'rifu hatha ar-rajula?) - Do you know this man?

when_to_say: When talking about cooling or ventilation
example: اِشْتَرَيْتُ مَرْوَحَةً. (ishtaraytu marwahatun) - I bought a fan.
المَرْوَحَةُ تَدُورُ. (al-marwahatu tadooru) - The fan is spinning.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى مَرْوَحَةٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila marwahatin?) - Do you need a fan?
المَرْوَحَةُ سَتُبَرِّدُ الغُرْفَةَ. (al-marwahatu satubarridu al-ghurfah) - The fan will cool the room.

when_to_say: When talking about rooms or spaces
example: أَنَا فِي القَمَرَةِ. (ana fi al-qamrah) - I am in the room.
القَمَرَةُ صَغِيرَةٌ. (al-qamrah sagheerah) - The room is small.
هَلْ هُناكَ قَمَرَةٌ جَديدةٌ؟ (hal hunaaka qamrah jadeedah?) - Is there a new room?
القَمَرَةُ نَظِيفَةٌ. (al-qamrah nazeefah) - The room is clean.

when_to_say: When talking about a place of worship
example: الْمَسْجِدُ جَميلٌ. (al-masjidu jameel) - The mosque is beautiful.
أَنَا فِي المَسْجِدِ. (ana fi al-masjid) - I am in the mosque.
الْمَسْجِدُ قَرِيبٌ مِنَ المَنزِلِ. (al-masjidu qareebun min al-manzil) - The mosque is near the house.
هَلْ تَذْهَبُ إِلَى المَسْجِدِ؟ (hal tadhhabu ila al-masjid?) - Do you go to the mosque?
أَنَا أَقْوُدُ سَيَّارَةً. (ana aqoodu sayyarah) - I drive a car.
السَّيَّارَةُ سَرِيعَةٌ. (as-sayyaarah saree'ah) - The car is fast.
هَلْ تَمْلِكُ سَيَّارَةً؟ (hal tamliku sayyarah?) - Do you own a car?
سَيَّارَتِي حَمْرَاءُ. (sayyaaratee hamraa) - My car is red.
أَنَا أَرْكَبُ دَرَّاجَةً. (ana arkabu darraajatan) - I ride a bicycle.
الدَّرَّاجَةُ جَميلَةٌ. (ad-darraajat jameelah) - The bicycle is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ دَرَّاجَةً؟ (hal tuhibbu darraajatan?) - Do you like bicycles?
الدَّرَّاجَةُ سَريعةٌ. (ad-darraajatu saree'ah) - The bicycle is fast.

when_to_say: When talking about education or institutions
example: أَنَا فِي الجَامِعَةِ. (ana fi al-jaamiah) - I am in the university.
الجَامِعَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-jaamiah kabeerah) - The university is large.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى جَامِعَةٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila jaamiah?) - Do you need a university?
الجَامِعَةُ تَقَعُ فِي المَدِينَةِ. (al-jaamiah taqa'u fi al-madinah) - The university is located in the city.

when_to_say: When talking about animals or food
example: أَنَا أَكُلُ السَّمَكِ. (ana akulu as-samak) - I eat fish.
السَّمَكُ طَيِّبٌ. (as-samaku tayyib) - The fish is tasty.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ السَّمَكَ؟ (hal tuhibbu as-samak?) - Do you like fish?
رَأَيْتُ سَمَكًا فِي الحَوْضِ. (ra'aytu samakan fi al-hawdh) - I saw a fish in the pond.

when_to_say: When talking about work or study spaces
example: أَنَا فِي المَكْتَبِ. (ana fi al-maktab) - I am in the office.
المَكْتَبُ نَظِيفٌ. (al-maktabu nazeef) - The office is clean.
هَلْ تَعْمَلُ فِي المَكْتَبِ؟ (hal ta'malu fi al-maktab?) - Do you work in the office?
المَكْتَبُ يَحْتَوِي عَلَى حَاسُوبٍ. (al-maktabu yahtawi 'ala hasoob) - The office contains a computer.

when_to_say: When talking about a mosque or place of worship
example: أَنَا فِي المَسْجِدِ. (ana fi al-masjid) - I am in the mosque.
المَسْجِدُ جَميلٌ. (al-masjidu jameel) - The mosque is beautiful.
هَلْ تَذْهَبُ إِلَى المَسْجِدِ؟ (hal tadhhabu ila al-masjid?) - Do you go to the mosque?
المَسْجِدُ فِي الزُّهُورِ. (al-masjidu fi az-zuhur) - The mosque is in the garden.

when_to_say: When talking about healthcare or medicine
example: أَنَا طَبِيبٌ. (ana taabeeb) - I am a doctor.
الطَّبِيبُ جَادٌّ. (at-taabeebu jaad) - The doctor is serious.
الطَّبِيبُ فِي الْمُسْتَشْفَى. (at-taabeebu fi al-mustashfa) - The doctor is in the hospital.
هَلْ زُرْتَ الطَّبِيبَ؟ (hal zurtat at-taabeeb?) - Did you visit the doctor?

when_to_say: When talking about a door or entrance
example: البَابُ مَفْتُوحٌ. (al-baabu maftooh) - The door is open.
هَلْ غَلَقْتَ البَابَ؟ (hal ghalaqtal baaba?) - Did you close the door?
البَابُ جَميلٌ. (al-baabu jameel) - The door is beautiful.
البَابُ يَحْتَاجُ إِلَى صِيانَةٍ. (al-baabu yahtaj ila siyaanah) - The door needs repair.

when_to_say: When talking about reading or books
example: أَنَا أَقْرَأُ كِتَابًا. (ana aqra'u kitaaban) - I am reading a book.
الْكِتَابُ جَميلٌ. (al-kitaabu jameel) - The book is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ قِرَاءَةَ الكُتُبِ؟ (hal tuhibbu qira'at al-kutub?) - Do you like reading books?
الْكِتَابُ عَلَى الطَّاوِلَةِ. (al-kitaabu 'ala at-taawilah) - The book is on the table.

when_to_say: When talking about meals or food
example: أَنَا آكُلُ طَعَامًا. (ana aakulu ta'aaman) - I am eating food.
الطَّعَامُ لَذِيذٌ. (at-ta'aamu latheez) - The food is delicious.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الطَّعَامَ؟ (hal tuhibbu at-ta'aama?) - Do you like the food?
الطَّعَامُ جَميلٌ. (at-ta'aamu jameel) - The food is beautiful.

when_to_say: When talking about drinking or water
example: أَنَا أَشْرَبُ مَاءً. (ana ashrabu maaan) - I drink water.
الْمَاءُ بَارِدٌ. (al-maaa'u baareed) - The water is cold.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ المَاءَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-maa?) - Do you like water?
المَاءُ نَقِيٌّ. (al-maa'u naqqee) - The water is pure.

when_to_say: When talking about flowers or nature
example: الوردةُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-wardatu jameelah) - The rose is beautiful.
أَنَا أُحِبُّ الوَرْدَةَ. (ana uhibbu al-warda) - I love the rose.
الوردةُ حَمْرَاءُ. (al-wardatu hamra') - The rose is red.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الوَرْدَةَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-warda?) - Do you like the rose?

when_to_say: When talking about the weather or nature
example: السَّمَاءُ زَرْقَاءُ. (as-samaa'oo zarqaa) - The sky is blue.
السَّمَاءُ صَافِيَةٌ. (as-samaa'oo saafiyah) - The sky is clear.
هَلْ تَرَى السَّمَاءَ؟ (hal taraa as-samaa?) - Do you see the sky?
السَّمَاءُ مُمْطِرَةٌ. (as-samaa'oo mumtirah) - The sky is rainy.

when_to_say: When talking about nature or plants
example: الشَّجَرَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (ash-shajarah kabeerah) - The tree is large.
أَنَا تَحْتَ الشَّجَرَةِ. (ana taht as-shajarah) - I am under the tree.
الشَّجَرَةُ خَضْرَاءُ. (ash-shajarah khadraa') - The tree is green.
هَلْ تَرَى الشَّجَرَةَ؟ (hal taraa as-shajarah?) - Do you see the tree?
أَنَا أَقْرَأُ مَجَلَّةً. (ana aqra'u majallatan) - I am reading a magazine.
المَجَلَّةُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-majallatu jameelah) - The magazine is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ قِرَاءَةَ المَجَلَّاتِ؟ (hal tuhibbu qira'at al-majallaat?) - Do you like reading magazines?
المَجَلَّةُ فِي الجَارِدَةِ. (al-majallatu fi al-jaareedah) - The magazine is in the newspaper.

when_to_say: When talking about sports or play
example: أَنَا أَلْعَبُ بِالكُرَةِ. (ana al'abu bil-kurah) - I play with the ball.
الكُرَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-kurah kabeerah) - The ball is big.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الكُرَةَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-kurah?) - Do you like the ball?
الكُرَةُ زَرْقَاءُ. (al-kurah zarqaa) - The ball is blue.
يَتَسَاقَطُ المَطَرُ. (yatasaaqatu al-matar) - The rain is falling.
المَطَرُ غَزِيرٌ. (al-mataru ghazeer) - The rain is heavy.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ المَطَرَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-matar?) - Do you like the rain?
المَطَرُ فِي الفَجْرِ. (al-mataru fi al-fajr) - The rain is in the morning.
أَنَا أَكْتُبُ بِالقَلَمِ. (ana aktubu bil-qalami) - I write with the pen.
القَلَمُ جَميلٌ. (al-qalamu jameel) - The pen is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى قَلَمٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila qalam?) - Do you need a pen?
القَلَمُ أَزْرَقُ. (al-qalamu azraq) - The pen is blue.

when_to_say: When talking about windows or views
example: النافِذَةُ مَفْتُوحَةٌ. (an-naafidhah maftooha) - The window is open.
هَلْ تَغْلِقُ النَّافِذَةَ؟ (hal taghliq an-naafidhah?) - Do you close the window?
النافِذَةُ صَافِيَةٌ. (an-naafidhah saafiyah) - The window is clear.
النافِذَةُ تَحْتَارُ. (an-naafidhah tahtaar) - The window is shining.

when_to_say: When talking about animals or nature
example: الطَّائِرُ يَطِيرُ. (at-ta'iru yateeru) - The bird is flying.
الطَّائِرُ صَغِيرٌ. (at-ta'iru sagheer) - The bird is small.
هَلْ تَرَى الطَّائِرَ؟ (hal taraa at-ta'ira?) - Do you see the bird?
الطَّائِرُ جَميلٌ. (at-ta'iru jameel) - The bird is beautiful.

when_to_say: When talking about places to buy things
example: أَنَا فِي المَحَلِّ. (ana fi al-mahal) - I am in the store.
المَحَلُّ جَميلٌ. (al-mahalu jameel) - The store is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الشِّرَاءَ مِنْ المَحَلِّ؟ (hal tuhibbu ash-shira'a min al-mahal?) - Do you like shopping in the store?
المَحَلُّ فِي الزُّهُورِ. (al-mahalu fi az-zuhur) - The store is in the flowers.

when_to_say: When talking about beaches or places by the sea
example: أَنَا فِي الشَّاطِئِ. (ana fi ash-shate') - I am on the beach.
الشَّاطِئُ جَميلٌ. (ash-shate'u jameel) - The beach is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الذَّهَابَ إِلَى الشَّاطِئِ؟ (hal tuhibbu adh-dhahab ila ash-shate'?) - Do you like going to the beach?
الشَّاطِئُ هَادِئٌ. (ash-shate'u haadee') - The beach is calm.

when_to_say: When talking about animals or farms
example: الزُرَيْبَةُ نَظِيفَةٌ. (az-zuraibah nazeefah) - The stable is clean.
أَنَا فِي الزُرَيْبَةِ. (ana fi az-zuraibah) - I am in the stable.
الزُرَيْبَةُ لِلْخَيْلِ. (az-zuraibah lil-khayl) - The stable is for the horses.
هَلْ تَرَى الزُرَيْبَةَ؟ (hal taraa az-zuraibah?) - Do you see the stable?

when_to_say: When talking about metals or materials
example: الْحَدِيدُ قَوِيٌّ. (al-hadeedu qawiyy) - The iron is strong.
أَنَا أَشْتَرِي حَدِيدًا. (ana ashtari hadeedan) - I am buying iron.
الْحَدِيدُ غَالِيٌّ. (al-hadeedu ghaaleey) - The iron is expensive.
يَحْتَاجُ الْحَدِيدُ إِلَى صَفٍّ. (yahtaj al-hadeed ila saff) - The iron needs to be refined.

when_to_say: When talking about animals or pets
example: القِطُّ جَميلٌ. (al-qittu jameel) - The cat is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ القِطَطَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-qitaat?) - Do you like cats?
القِطُّ لَعِبٌ. (al-qittu la'ib) - The cat is playing.
أَنَا أَحْتَفِظُ بِالْقِطِّ. (ana ahtafiz bil-qit) - I keep the cat.

when_to_say: When talking about geography or nature
example: الجَبَلُ عَالٍ. (al-jabal 'aalin) - The mountain is high.
أَنَا فِي الجَبَلِ. (ana fi al-jabali) - I am on the mountain.
الجَبَلُ بَارِدٌ. (al-jabalu baareed) - The mountain is cold.
هَلْ تَرَى الجَبَلَ؟ (hal taraa al-jabala?) - Do you see the mountain?

when_to_say: When talking about opening or locking
example: أَنَا أَفْتَحُ بِالْمَفْتَاحِ. (ana aftahu bil-maftahi) - I open with the key.
المَفْتَاحُ ضَائِعٌ. (al-maftah daai'un) - The key is lost.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى مَفْتَاحٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila maftah?) - Do you need a key?
المَفْتَاحُ جَميلٌ. (al-maftah jameel) - The key is beautiful.

when_to_say: When talking about workspaces or furniture
example: أَنَا جَالِسٌ فِي المَكْتَبِ. (ana jaalisun fi al-maktabi) - I am sitting at the desk.
المَكْتَبُ نَظِيفٌ. (al-maktabu nazeef) - The desk is clean.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى مَكْتَبٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila maktab?) - Do you need a desk?
المَكْتَبُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-maktabu kabeer) - The desk is big.

when_to_say: When talking about furniture or surfaces
example: الطَّاوِلَةُ جَميلَةٌ. (at-taawilatu jameelah) - The table is beautiful.
أَنَا أَكْتُبُ عَلَى الطَّاوِلَةِ. (ana aktubu 'ala at-taawilati) - I write on the table.
الطَّاوِلَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (at-taawilatu kabeerah) - The table is large.
هلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى طَاوِلَةٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila taawilah?) - Do you need a table?

when_to_say: When talking about temperature, grades, or levels
example: الْحَرَارَةُ فِي دَرَجَةٍ عَالِيَةٍ. (al-haraarah fi darajah 'aaliyyah) - The temperature is at a high degree.
دَرَجَتُهُ عَالِيَةٌ. (darajatuhu 'aaliyah) - His grade is high.
الْدَرَجَةُ 20. (ad-darajah 'ishroon) - The degree is 20.
هَلْ تَرَى دَرَجَتَك؟ (hal taraa darajatak?) - Do you see your degree?

when_to_say: When talking about parts or divisions of a whole
example: أَنَا فِي القِسْمِ. (ana fi al-qismi) - I am in the section.
القِسْمُ مُفَصَّلٌ. (al-qismu mufassal) - The department is detailed.
الْقِسْمُ جَميلٌ. (al-qismu jameel) - The section is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ القِسْمَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-qisma?) - Do you like the section?

when_to_say: When talking about furniture or storage
example: الخَزَانَةُ مَفْتُوحَةٌ. (al-khazaana maftoohah) - The cupboard is open.
أَنَا فِي الخَزَانَةِ. (ana fi al-khazaana) - I am in the cupboard.
الخَزَانَةُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-khazaana jameelah) - The cupboard is beautiful.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى خَزَانَةٍ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila khazaana?) - Do you need a cupboard?

when_to_say: When talking about minerals or materials
example: الحَجَرُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-hajaroo kabeer) - The stone is big.
أَنَا أَحْمِلُ حَجَرًا. (ana ahmilu hajaran) - I am carrying a stone.
الحَجَرُ قَاسٍ. (al-hajar qaas) - The stone is hard.
هلْ تَرَى الحَجَرَ؟ (hal taraa al-hajara?) - Do you see the stone?
أَنَا أَنْظُرُ فِي المِرْآةِ. (ana anzuru fi al-mir'ah) - I look in the mirror.
المِرْآةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-mir'atu kabeerah) - The mirror is big.
المِرْآةُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-mir'atu jameelah) - The mirror is beautiful.
هلْ تَرَى النَّفْسَ فِي المِرْآةِ؟ (hal taraa an-nafs fi al-mir'ah?) - Do you see yourself in the mirror?

when_to_say: When talking about modes of transport
example: أَنَا أَرْكَبُ دَرَّاجَةً. (ana arkabu darraajatan) - I ride a bicycle.
الدَرَّاجَةُ حَمْرَاءُ. (ad-darraajatu hamraa) - The bicycle is red.
هلْ تَرَى الدَّارَّاجَةَ؟ (hal taraa ad-darraajata?) - Do you see the bicycle?
الدَرَّاجَةُ سَرِيعَةٌ. (ad-darraajatu saree'ah) - The bicycle is fast.

when_to_say: When talking about time or parts of the day
example: الفَجْرُ جَميلٌ. (al-fajr jameel) - The dawn is beautiful.
أَنَا أَصْحُو فِي الفَجْرِ. (ana ashu fi al-fajr) - I wake up at dawn.
الفَجْرُ يَأْتِي بَعْدَ اللَّيْلِ. (al-fajr ya'tee ba'da al-layl) - The dawn comes after the night.
هَلْ تَحِبُّ الفَجْرَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-fajr?) - Do you like the dawn?

when_to_say: When talking about body parts or actions
example: لَدَيَّ يَدٌ جَميلَةٌ. (ladayya yadun jameelah) - I have a beautiful hand.
يَدِي مَرِيضَةٌ. (yadee mareedah) - My hand is sick.
أَنَا أَمْدَحُ يَدِي. (ana amdahu yadee) - I praise my hand.
هلْ تُدَاوِي يَدَك؟ (hal tudaawi yadak?) - Do you treat your hand?

when_to_say: When referring to something inside another thing
example: الْكِتَابُ فِيهِ مَعْلُومَاتٌ. (al-kitaabu fihi ma'loomaatun) - The book has information in it.
هَلْ فِيهِ مَاءٌ؟ (hal fihi maaa'un?) - Is there water in it?
فِيهِ شَيْءٌ جَميلٌ. (fihi shay'un jameel) - There is something beautiful in it.
أَنَا فِيهِ. (ana fihi) - I am in it.
سَيَّارَتِي جَميلَةٌ. (sayyaratee jameelah) - My car is beautiful.
سَيَّارَتُهُ حَمْرَاءُ. (sayyaratuhu hamra') - His car is red.
أَنَا أَرْكَبُ سَيَّارَةً. (ana arkabu sayyara) - I ride a car.
هلْ تَحِبُّ السَّيَّارَةَ؟ (hal tuhibbu as-sayyarah?) - Do you like the car?

when_to_say: When talking about travel or locations
example: نَحْنُ فِي المَطَارِ. (nahnu fi al-mataar) - We are at the airport.
المَطَارُ بَعِيدٌ. (al-mataaru ba'eed) - The airport is far.
هَلْ تَحْتَاجُ إِلَى المَطَارِ؟ (hal tahtaaj ila al-mataar?) - Do you need the airport?
الْمَطَارُ جَميلٌ. (al-mataaru jameel) - The airport is beautiful.

when_to_say: When talking about education or jobs
example: المُدَرِّسُ جَميلٌ. (al-mudarrisu jameel) - The teacher is nice.
أَنَا أُحِبُّ المُدَرِّسَ. (ana uhibbu al-mudarrisa) - I love the teacher.
هَلْ أَنتَ مُدَرِّسٌ؟ (hal anta mudarris?) - Are you a teacher?
المُدَرِّسُ يَتَكَلَّمُ عَنِ التَّعْلِيمِ. (al-mudarrisu yatakallamu 'an at-ta'leem) - The teacher talks about education.
الْوَجْهُ جَميلٌ. (al-wajhu jameel) - The face is beautiful.
الرَّسْمُ جَميلٌ. (ar-rasmu jameel) - The drawing is beautiful.
الْمَنَاظِرُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-manaaziru jameelah) - The views are beautiful.
جَميلٌ جِدًّا. (jameelun jiddan) - Very beautiful.

when_to_say: When talking about places of worship
example: الْمَسْجِدُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-masjidu kabeer) - The mosque is big.
أَنَا ذَاهِبٌ إِلَى المَسْجِدِ. (ana dhaahibun ila al-masjidi) - I am going to the mosque.
المَسْجِدُ جَميلٌ. (al-masjidu jameel) - The mosque is beautiful.
هلْ تَصَلِّي فِي المَسْجِدِ؟ (hal tasallee fi al-masjidi?) - Do you pray at the mosque?

when_to_say: When talking about weather or nature
example: السَّمَاءُ زَرْقَاءُ. (as-samaa'oo zarqaa) - The sky is blue.
السَّمَاءُ مَجْهُولَةٌ. (as-samaa'oo majhoolah) - The sky is cloudy.
هَلْ تَرَى السَّمَاءَ؟ (hal taraa as-samaa?) - Do you see the sky?
السَّمَاءُ صَافِيَةٌ. (as-samaa'oo saafiyah) - The sky is clear.

when_to_say: When talking about parts of a house
example: النَّافِذَةُ مَفْتُوحَةٌ. (an-naafidhatu maftooha) - The window is open.
أَنَا أَغْلِقُ النَّافِذَةَ. (ana aghliqu an-naafidhah) - I close the window.
النَّافِذَةُ جَميلَةٌ. (an-naafidhatu jameelah) - The window is beautiful.
هلْ تُغْلِقُ النَّافِذَةَ؟ (hal tughleequ an-naafidhah?) - Do you close the window?

when_to_say: When referring to someone dear or loved
example: أَنْتَ حَبِيبٌ لِي. (anta habeebun lee) - You are dear to me.
أَنَا حَبِيبٌ لِهَذِهِ الفَتَاةِ. (ana habeebun li hathihi al-fataah) - I am dear to this girl.
حَبِيبَتِي جَميلَةٌ. (habeebatee jameelah) - My beloved is beautiful.
هلْ أَنْتَ حَبِيبٌ؟ (hal anta habeeb?) - Are you loved?

when_to_say: When talking about emotions or the heart
example: قَلْبِي سَعِيدٌ. (qalbee sa'eed) - My heart is happy.
قَلْبُهُ جَميلٌ. (qalbuhu jameel) - His heart is beautiful.
أَنَا أَحِبُّكِ بِقَلْبِي. (ana uhibbuki bi qalbee) - I love you with my heart.
هلْ قَلْبُكِ مَرِيضٌ؟ (hal qalbuki mareed?) - Is your heart sick?
عَيْنِي جَميلَةٌ. (aynee jameelah) - My eye is beautiful.
لَدَيَّ عَيْنَانِ. (ladayya 'aynaan) - I have two eyes.
عَيْنُهُ زَرْقَاءُ. (aynuhoo zarqaa') - His eye is blue.
هلْ عَيْنُكَ مَرِيضَةٌ؟ (hal 'aynuka mareedah?) - Is your eye sick?

when_to_say: When talking about reading or education
example: أَنَا أَقْرَأُ كِتَابًا. (ana aqra'u kitaaban) - I am reading a book.
الْكِتَابُ جَميلٌ. (al-kitaabu jameel) - The book is beautiful.
أَحْتَاجُ إِلَى كِتَابٍ. (ahtaaju ila kitaabin) - I need a book.
هلْ لَكَ كِتَابٌ جَديدٌ؟ (hal laka kitaabun jadeed?) - Do you have a new book?

when_to_say: When talking about drinks or nature
example: أَشْرَبُ مَاءً. (ashrabu maa'an) - I drink water.
الْمَاءُ بَارِدٌ. (al-maa'u baarid) - The water is cold.
هَلْ تَشْرَبُ مَاءً؟ (hal tashrabu maa'an?) - Do you drink water?
الْمَاءُ نَظِيفٌ. (al-maa'u nazeef) - The water is clean.

when_to_say: When talking about education or schools
example: أَنَا فِي الجَامِعَةِ. (ana fi al-jaami'ah) - I am at the university.
الجَامِعَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-jaami'atu kabeerah) - The university is large.
هَلْ تَذْهَبُ إِلَى الجَامِعَةِ؟ (hal tadhhabu ila al-jaami'ah?) - Do you go to the university?
الجَامِعَةُ جَميلَةٌ. (al-jaami'ah jameelah) - The university is beautiful.

when_to_say: When talking about trips or journeys
example: أَنَا فِي سَفَرٍ. (ana fi safarin) - I am on a trip.
سَفَرُهُ طَوِيلٌ. (safaruhoo taweel) - His travel is long.
هَلْ سَافَرْتَ إِلَى فَرَنْسَا؟ (hal saafarta ila faransaa?) - Did you travel to France?
السَّفَرُ مُمْتِعٌ. (as-safarum mumti') - The travel is enjoyable.

when_to_say: When talking about nature or plants
example: الشَّجَرَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (ash-shajaratu kabeerah) - The tree is big.
لَدَيَّ شَجَرَةٌ جَميلَةٌ. (ladayya shajarah jameelah) - I have a beautiful tree.
الشَّجَرَةُ لِلطَّعَامِ. (ash-shajaratu lit-ta'aam) - The tree is for food.
هلْ تَحِبُّ الشَّجَرَةَ؟ (hal tuhibbu ash-shajarah?) - Do you like the tree?

when_to_say: When talking about places or locations
example: الْمُدِينَةُ كَبِيرَةٌ. (al-madeenatu kabeerah) - The city is big.

المَسْجِدُ كَبِيرٌ. (al-masjidu kabeer) - The mosque is large.
هلْ ذَهَبْتَ إِلَى المَسْجِدِ؟ (hal dhahabta ila al-masjid?) - Did you go to the mosque?
السَّمَاءُ زَرْقَاءُ. (as-sama'aa' zarqaa') - The sky is blue.
هلْ تَرَى السَّمَاءَ؟ (hal tara as-sama'?) - Do you see the sky?
الشَّمسُ سَاطِعَةٌ. (ash-shamsu saate'ah) - The sun is shining.
هلْ تَرَى الشَّمسَ؟ (hal tara ash-shams?) - Do you see the sun?
المَطَرُ غَزِيرٌ. (al-mataru ghazeer) - The rain is heavy.
هلْ تَحِبُّ المَطَرَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-matar?) - Do you like the rain?
الْقُبْلَةُ نَاعِمَةٌ. (al-qublatu na'imah) - The kiss is soft.
هلْ تَحِبُّ الشَّعْرَ النَّاعِمَ؟ (hal tuhibbu ash-sha'ra an-na'im?) - Do you like soft hair?
الطَّبِيبُ فِي المَسْتَشْفَى. (at-tabeebu fi al-mashtashfaa) - The doctor is in the hospital.
هلْ زُرْتَ الطَّبِيبَ؟ (hal zurta at-tabeeb?) - Did you visit the doctor?
المَطْبَخُ نَظيفٌ. (al-matbakhu nazeef) - The kitchen is clean.
هلْ تَحِبُّ الطَّبْخَ؟ (hal tuhibbu at-tabkh?) - Do you like cooking?
أَنا فِي المَطْبَخِ. (ana fi al-matbakh) - I am in the kitchen.
القِطَارُ سَرِيعٌ. (al-qitaru saree'ah) - The train is fast.
هلْ رَكِبْتَ القِطَارَ؟ (hal rakibta al-qitara?) - Did you ride the train?
السَّحَابُ كَثِيفٌ. (as-sahaabu katheef) - The cloud is thick.
هلْ تَرَى السَّحَابَ؟ (hal tara as-sahaab?) - Do you see the cloud?
السَّحَابُ أَبْيَضُ. (as-sahaabu abyad) - The cloud is white.
المُدَرِّسُ جَادٌ. (al-mudarresu jaad) - The teacher is serious.
هلْ تَحِبُّ المُدَرِّسَ؟ (hal tuhibbu al-mudarresa?) - Do you like the teacher?
الكُرَةُ حَمْرَاءُ. (al-kurah hamraa') - The ball is red.
هلْ تَلْعَبُ بِالكُرَةِ؟ (hal tal'abu bil-kurati?) - Do you play with the ball?
المَاءُ بَارِدٌ. (al-maa'u baarid) - The water is cold.
هلْ تَشْرَبُ المَاءَ؟ (hal tashrabu al-maa?) - Do you drink water?
أَنا أُحِبُّ المَاءَ. (ana uhibbu al-maa) - I love water.
الرَّجُلُ طَوِيلٌ. (ar-rajulu taweel) - The man is tall.
هلْ تَعْرِفُ الرَّجُلَ؟ (hal ta'arifu ar-rajula?) - Do you know the man?
الجَمَلُ سَارَ فِي الصَّحْرَاءِ. (al-jamal saara fi as-sahra') - The camel walked in the desert.
هلْ تَرَى الجَمَلَ؟ (hal tara al-jamal?) - Do you see the camel?
المُحَارِبُ شَجَاعٌ. (al-muhaarebu shujaa') - The warrior is brave.
هلْ كَانَ المُحَارِبُ فِي القِتَالِ؟ (hal kaana al-muhaarebu fi al-qitaal?) - Was the warrior in the fight?
المَدْرَسَةُ قَرِيبَةٌ. (al-madrasa qareebah) - The school is near.

الحَاسُوبُ جَديدٌ. (al-hasoo'bu jadeed) - The computer is new.

المَسْجِدُ جَميلٌ. (al-masjidu jameel) - The mosque is beautiful.
هلْ زُرْتَ المَسْجِدَ؟ (hal zurta al-masjida?) - Did you visit the mosque?

example: الْمُنْظَرُ جَميلٌ. (al-manzaru jameel) - The view is beautiful.

example: القَطُّ صَغِيرٌ. (al-qattu saqeeb) - The cat is small.
لَدَيَّ صَغِيرٌ جَميلٌ. (ladayya saqeebun jameel) - I have a small beautiful one.
جَاءَ الرَّجُلُ. (jaa'a ar-rajulu) - The man came.
هَلْ جَاءَ؟ (hal jaa'a?) - Did he come?
المَشْرَبُ لَذِيذٌ. (al-mashrabu latheez) - The drink is delicious.
أَيْنَ المَشْرَبُ؟ (ayna al-mashrab?) - Where is the drink?
هُوَ مُسَافِرٌ إِلَى دُبَيٍ. (huwa musaafirun ila Dubai) - He is a traveler to Dubai.
أَنَا مُسَافِرٌ. (ana musaafir) - I am a traveler.
الْجَامِعَةُ جَمِيلَةٌ. (al-jaami'atu jameelah) - The university is beautiful.
أَيْنَ تَقَعُ الجَامِعَةُ؟ (ayna taqaa'u al-jaami'atu?) - Where is the university?
الْمَلِكُ حَكَمَ المَمْلَكَةِ. (al-malikoo hakama al-mamlakah) - The king ruled the kingdom.
الْمَلِكُ يَحْكُمُ. (al-malikoo yahkumu) - The king rules.
أَنَا مَعَ صَدِيقِي. (ana ma'a sadeeqee) - I am with my friend.
أَذْهَبُ مَعَكِ. (adhhabu ma'ak) - I am going with you.

when_to_say: When referring to a degree or level
example: الدَرَجَةُ عَالِيَةٌ. (ad-daraajatu aaliyah) - The level is high.
أَيْنَ الدَرَجَةُ؟ (ayna ad-daraajah?) - Where is the degree?
القَلْبُ صَحِيحٌ. (al-qalbu saheeh) - The heart is healthy.
لَدَيَّ قَلْبٌ طَيِّبٌ. (ladayya qalbun tayyib) - I have a kind heart.
أَنَا أَقْرَأُ المَجَلَّةَ. (ana aqra'u al-majalat) - I am reading the magazine.
هَلْ لَكِ مَجَلَّةٌ؟ (hal laki majalat?) - Do you have a magazine?
هُوَ سَرِيعٌ. (huwa saree') - He is fast.
السيَّارَةُ سَرِيعَةٌ. (as-sayyaratu saree'ah) - The car is fast.
الطَّعَامُ لَذِيذٌ. (at-ta'aamu latheez) - The food is delicious.
هلْ تَحِبُّ الطَّعَامَ؟ (hal tuhibb at-ta'aama?) - Do you like the food?
هُوَ وَاقِفٌ. (huwa waaqif) - He is standing.
أَنَا وَاقِفٌ فِي الطَّابُورِ. (ana waaqifun fee at-taabooree) - I am standing in the line.

when_to_say: When referring to someone as sick
example: هُوَ مَرِيضٌ. (huwa mareedh) - He is sick.
أَنَا مَرِيضٌ. (ana mareedh) - I am sick.
الحَقِيبَةُ جَمِيلَةٌ. (al-haqeebatu jameelah) - The bag is beautiful.
أَيْنَ الحَقِيبَةُ؟ (ayna al-haqeebatu?) - Where is the bag?
الرَّجُلُ ذَكِيٌّ. (ar-rajulu thakee) - The man is smart.
هُوَ رَجُلٌ جَميلٌ. (huwa rajulun jameel) - He is a handsome man.
السيَّارَةُ حَمْرَاءُ. (as-sayyaratu hamraa') - The car is red.
أَنَا لَا أَمْلِكُ سَيَّارَةٌ. (ana laa amliku sayyaarah) - I don't own a car.
الْكِتَابُ جَيِّدٌ. (al-kitaabu jayyid) - The book is good.
أَنَا أَقْرَأُ الكِتَابَ. (ana aqra'u al-kitaab) - I am reading the book.

when_to_say: When referring to a degree (temperature or level)
example: الْحَرَارَةُ 30 دَرَجَةً. (al-haraarah thalaathoon daraajatan) - The temperature is 30 degrees.
لَدَيَّ دَرَجَةٌ عَالِيَةٌ فِي المَدْرَسَةِ. (ladayya daraajatan aaliyatan fi al-madrasati) - I have a high grade in school.
الشَّجَرَةُ عَالِيَةٌ. (ash-shajaratu aaliyah) - The tree is tall.
أَنَا زَرَعْتُ الشَّجَرَةَ. (ana zara'tu ash-shajarah) - I planted the tree.
المَسْجِدُ جَمِيلٌ. (al-masjidu jameel) - The mosque is beautiful.
نَحْنُ نَذْهَبُ إِلَى المَسْجِدِ. (nahnu nadhhabu ila al-masjidi) - We go to the mosque.

when_to_say: When referring to a male teacher
example: الْمُدَرِّسُ طَيِّبٌ. (al-mudarrisu tayyib) - The teacher is kind.
أَنَا مُدَرِّسٌ. (ana mudarris) - I am a teacher.
أَنَا أَشْرَبُ المَاءَ. (ana ashrabu al-maa') - I drink water.
الْمَاءُ بَارِدٌ. (al-maa'u baarid) - The water is cold.
السَّمَاءُ زَرْقَاءُ. (as-samaa'u zarqaa') - The sky is blue.
أَنَا أُحِبُّ النَّظَرَ إِلَى السَّمَاءِ. (ana uhibbu an-nazara ila as-samaa') - I love looking at the sky.
الزُّهْرَةُ جَمِيلَةٌ. (az-zuhrah jameelah) - The flower is beautiful.
أَنَا أَشْتَرِي الزُّهْرَةَ. (ana ashtari az-zuhrah) - I buy the flower.

when_to_say: When referring to feeling of being away from home
example: الشَّعُورُ بِالغُرْبَةِ صَعْبٌ. (ash-sha'ooru bil-ghurbah sa'b) - The feeling of estrangement is difficult.
عِيشَتُهُ فِي الغُرْبَةِ. (eishatuhu fi al-ghurbah) - His life is in estrangement.

when_to_say: When discussing the concept of understanding or awareness.
example: طَرِيقُ المَعْرِفَةِ طَوِيلٌ. (tariqul ma'rifah tawil) - The path to knowledge is long.
المَعْرِفَةُ نُورٌ. (al-ma'rifah noor) - Knowledge is light.

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude or valuing something.
example: لَدَيْهِ تَقْدِيرٌ لِعَمَلِكَ. (ladayhi taqdeer li'amalika) - He has appreciation for your work.
التَّقْدِيرُ يُقَوِّي العَلاقَاتِ. (at-taqdeer yuqawwi al-alaqat) - Appreciation strengthens relationships.

when_to_say: When describing a difficult task or situation.
example: التَّحَدِّي يَصْنَعُ القُوَّةَ. (at-tahaddi yasna'ul quwwah) - Challenge builds strength.
قَبِلَ التَّحَدِّي بِشَجَاعَةٍ. (qabila at-tahaddi bishaja'ah) - He accepted the challenge with courage.
التَّسَامُحُ صِفَةٌ نَبِيلَةٌ. (at-tasamuh sifah nabilah) - Tolerance is a noble trait.
عَلَيْنَا أَنْ نَتَسَامَحَ. (alayna an natasamah) - We must be tolerant.
النَّجَاحُ يُحَقِّقُ السَّعَادَةَ. (an-najah yuhakiqu as-sa'adah) - Success brings happiness.
هُوَ قِصَّةُ نَجَاحٍ. (huwa qissat najah) - He is a success story.
الحَرِيَّةُ حَقٌّ أَسَاسِيٌّ. (al-hurriyyah haqqun asasi) - Freedom is a basic right.
النِّضَالُ مِنْ أَجْلِ الحَرِيَّةِ. (an-nidal min ajl al-hurriyyah) - The struggle for freedom.

when_to_say: When talking about strong relationships between friends.
example: الصِّدَاقَةُ تُقَوِّي الحَيَاةَ. (as-sidqah tuqawwi al-hayat) - Friendship strengthens life.
هَذِهِ صِدَاقَةٌ حَقِيقِيَّةٌ. (hadhihi sidqah haqiqiyyah) - This is a true friendship.
الشُّجَاعَةُ مَطْلُوبَةٌ فِي الوَقْتِ الحَاسِمِ. (ash-shuja'ah matloobah fil-waqt al-hasim) - Courage is needed in critical times.
تَحَلَّى بِالشُّجَاعَةِ. (tahalla bish-shuja'ah) - Show courage.

when_to_say: When discussing deep understanding or insight.
example: الحِكْمَةُ ثَمِينَةٌ. (al-hikmah thaminah) - Wisdom is precious.
مَنْ يَتَعَلَّمُ الحِكْمَةَ يَزْدَدْ عِلْمًا. (man yata'allam al-hikmah yazdad ilman) - He who learns wisdom gains more knowledge.

when_to_say: When admiring innovative ideas or solutions.
example: الإِبْدَاعُ يُغَيِّرُ العَالَمَ. (al-ibda' yughayyiru al-alam) - Creativity changes the world.
لَدَيْهِ عَقْلٌ مُبْدِعٌ. (ladayhi 'aql mubdi') - He has a creative mind.
الإِخْلَاصُ مَطْلُوبٌ فِي العَمَلِ. (al-ikhlas matloobun fil-amal) - Sincerity is needed in work.
تَكَلَّمَ بِإِخْلَاصٍ. (takallama bi-ikhlas) - He spoke with sincerity.

when_to_say: When encouraging endurance during tough times.
example: الصَّبْرُ يُؤَدِّي إِلَى النَّجَاحِ. (as-sabr yu'addi ila an-najah) - Patience leads to success.
كُنْ صَابِرًا. (kun sabiran) - Be patient.
الأَمَلُ يُقَوِّي القَلْبَ. (al-amal yuqawwi al-qalb) - Hope strengthens the heart.
عَلَيْنَا أَنْ نُحَافِظَ عَلَى الأَمَلِ. (alayna an nuhafiz ala al-amal) - We must hold on to hope.
الفَرَحُ يُمْلِئُ القُلُوبَ. (al-farah yumli'u al-quloob) - Joy fills hearts.
يَحْتَفِلُونَ بِالفَرَحِ. (yahtafiloon bil-farah) - They celebrate with joy.
القُوَّةُ فِي الوَحْدَةِ. (al-quwwah fil-wahdah) - Strength lies in unity.
هَذَا دَلِيلٌ عَلَى قُوَّتِهِ. (hadha dalil ala quwwatihi) - This is evidence of his strength.

when_to_say: When talking about personal or intellectual growth.
example: النُّضْجُ يَتَطَلَّبُ تَجَارِبَ. (an-nudj yatatalabu tajareb) - Maturity requires experiences.
قَدْ بَلَغَ مَرْحَلَةَ النُّضْجِ. (qad balagha marhalat an-nudj) - He has reached the stage of maturity.
التَّفَاؤُلُ يُنِيرُ الحَيَاةَ. (at-tafa'ul yuneer al-hayat) - Optimism lights up life.
عَلَيْكَ بِالتَّفَاؤُلِ. (alayka bit-tafa'ul) - You should be optimistic.

when_to_say: When discussing selflessness or giving up something valuable.
example: التَّضْحِيَةُ مَطْلُوبَةٌ أَحْيَانًا. (at-tadhiyah matloobah ahyanan) - Sacrifice is sometimes needed.
قَدَّمَ التَّضْحِيَةَ لِأَسْرَتِهِ. (qaddama at-tadhiyah li'usratih) - He made a sacrifice for his family.

when_to_say: When promoting mutual regard and esteem.
example: الإِحْتِرَامُ أَسَاسُ العَلاقَةِ. (al-ihtiram asas al-alaqah) - Respect is the foundation of a relationship.
أَظْهِرَ الإِحْتِرَامَ لِجَمِيعِ النَّاسِ. (azhir al-ihtiram li-jamee'in-nas) - Show respect to everyone.
الإِلْتِزَامُ يُؤَدِّي إِلَى النَّجَاحِ. (al-iltizam yu'addi ila an-najah) - Commitment leads to success.
لَدَيْهِ إِلْتِزَامٌ كَبِيرٌ بِعَمَلِهِ. (ladayhi iltizam kabir bi'amalihi) - He has great commitment to his work.

when_to_say: When highlighting honesty in speech or actions.
example: الصِّدْقُ يُقَوِّي الثِّقَةَ. (as-sidq yuqawwi ath-thiqa) - Truthfulness strengthens trust.
كُنْ صَادِقًا. (kun sadiqan) - Be truthful.

when_to_say: When discussing affection or care for others.
example: المَحَبَّةُ تُجْمِلُ الحَيَاةَ. (al-mahabbah tujmilu al-hayat) - Love beautifies life.
عَلَيْنَا نَشْرُ المَحَبَّةِ. (alayna nashru al-mahabbah) - We must spread love.

when_to_say: When encouraging bravery in difficult situations.
example: الشَّجَاعَةُ تُؤَدِّي إِلَى النَّجَاحِ. (ash-shaja'ah tu'addi ila an-najah) - Courage leads to success.
أَظْهَرَ شَجَاعَتَهُ. (azhara shaja'atahu) - He displayed his courage.

when_to_say: When emphasizing thoughtful decisions or advice.
example: الحِكْمَةُ ضَالَّةُ المُؤْمِنِ. (al-hikmah dalat al-mu'min) - Wisdom is the believer's goal.
تَحَدَّثَ بِحِكْمَةٍ. (tahaddatha bihikmah) - He spoke wisely.

when_to_say: When discussing personal rights or independence.
example: الحُرِّيَّةُ حَقٌّ لِكُلِّ إِنْسَانٍ. (al-hurriyyah haqqun likulli insan) - Freedom is a right for every person.
تَمَتَّعَ بِالحُرِّيَّةِ. (tamatt'a bil-hurriyyah) - He enjoyed freedom.
الإِحْسَاسُ يُلْهِمُ الإِنْسَانَ. (al-ihsas yulhim al-insan) - Feeling inspires humans.
عِنْدِي إِحْسَاسٌ غَرِيبٌ. (indi ihsas gharib) - I have a strange feeling.
الوَفَاءُ يُعَزِّزُ العَلاقَةَ. (al-wafa' yu'azziz al-alaqah) - Loyalty strengthens the relationship.
وَفَاءُ الأَصْدِقَاءِ قِيمَةٌ. (wafa' al-asdiqa' qimah) - Loyalty of friends is valuable.
الرَّحْمَةُ تَزِيدُ المَحَبَّةَ. (ar-rahmah tazeed al-mahabbah) - Mercy increases love.
تَحَلَّى بِالرَّحْمَةِ. (tahalla bir-rahmah) - Be merciful.
الأَمَانَةُ أَسَاسُ الوَثَاقِ. (al-amanah asas al-watha') - Trust is the foundation of agreements.
لَيْسَ لَدَيْهِ أَمَانَةٌ. (laysa ladayhi amanah) - He lacks trustworthiness.
الحَيَاةُ هِيَ هِبَةٌ. (al-hayah hiya hibah) - Life is a gift.
عِشْ حَيَاتَكَ بِسَعَادَةٍ. (ish hayataka bisadah) - Live your life happily.

when_to_say: When encouraging calmness in difficult times.
example: الصَّبْرُ مِفْتَاحُ الفَرَجِ. (as-sabr miftah al-faraj) - Patience is the key to relief.
اصْبِرْ عَلَى المَصَاعِبِ. (isbir ala al-masa'ib) - Be patient with hardships.

when_to_say: When discussing belief in principles or spirituality.
example: الإِيمَانُ يُعَطِي القُوَّةَ. (al-iman yu'ti al-quwwah) - Faith gives strength.
إِيمَانُكَ قَوِيٌّ. (imanuka qawiyy) - Your faith is strong.

when_to_say: When referring to physical or mental power.
example: القُوَّةُ تَكْمُنُ فِي الإِرَادَةِ. (al-quwwah takmun fi al-iradah) - Strength lies in determination.
أَظْهَرَ قُوَّةً كَبِيرَةً. (azhara quwwatan kabirah) - He displayed great strength.
العَدَالَةُ تَضْمَنُ الحَقَّ. (al-adalah tadman al-haqq) - Justice ensures rights.
طَالَبَ بِالعَدَالَةِ. (talaba bil-adalah) - He demanded justice.
السَّعَادَةُ فِي القَنَاعَةِ. (as-sa'adah fi al-qana'ah) - Happiness is in contentment.
تَمَنَّى لَكَ السَّعَادَةَ. (tamanna laka as-sa'adah) - He wished you happiness.

when_to_say: When talking about grief or sorrow.
example: الحُزْنُ لَا يَدُومُ. (al-huzn la yadum) - Sadness doesn't last.
شَعَرَ بِالحُزْنِ العَمِيقِ. (sha'ara bil-huzn al-amiq) - He felt deep sadness.
الحُرُوفُ تُشَكِّلُ الكَلِمَاتِ. (al-huroof tushakkilu al-kalimat) - Letters form words.
تَعَلَّمَ الحُرُوفَ الجَدِيدَةَ. (ta'allama al-huroof al-jadeedah) - He learned new letters.
التَّفَاؤُلُ يَجْلِبُ النَّجَاحَ. (at-tafa'ul yajlib an-najah) - Optimism brings success.
كُنْ مُتَفَائِلًا. (kun mutafa'ilan) - Be optimistic.

when_to_say: When talking about admiration or honor.
example: الإِحْتِرَامُ يُوَحِّدُ المُجْتَمَعَ. (al-ihtiram yuwahidu al-mujtama') - Respect unites the community.
أَظْهَرَ إِحْتِرَامًا كَبِيرًا. (azhara ihtiraman kabiran) - He showed great respect.
الطَّمَأْنِينَةُ فِي الإِيمَانِ. (at-tama'ninah fi al-iman) - Peace lies in faith.
شَعَرَ بِطَمَأْنِينَةٍ كَبِيرَةٍ. (sha'ara bi-tama'ninah kabirah) - He felt great peace.

when_to_say: When talking about independence or liberty.
example: الحُرِّيَّةُ حَقٌّ طَبِيعِيٌّ. (al-hurriyyah haqqun tabi'i) - Freedom is a natural right.
يَطْلُبُ الحُرِّيَّةَ. (yatlobu al-hurriyyah) - He seeks freedom.

when_to_say: When encouraging positivity about the future.
example: الأَمَلُ يَجْعَلُ الحَيَاةَ جَمِيلَةً. (al-amal yaj'alu al-hayah jameelah) - Hope makes life beautiful.
عِنْدِي أَمَلٌ كَبِيرٌ. (indi amal kabir) - I have great hope.

when_to_say: When discussing one's country or place of belonging.
example: الوَطَنُ هُوَ المَنْزِلُ الأَوَّلُ. (al-watan huwa al-manzil al-awwal) - The homeland is the first home.
يُدَافِعُ عَنِ الوَطَنِ. (yudafi'u an al-watan) - He defends the homeland.
العِلْمُ نُورٌ. (al-ilm noor) - Knowledge is light.
طَلَبَ العِلْمَ طُولَ الحَيَاةِ. (talaba al-ilm tool al-hayah) - He sought knowledge throughout life.
النَّجَاحُ يَحْتَاجُ إِلَى جُهُودٍ. (an-najah yahtaj ila juhud) - Success requires effort.
تَمَتَّعَ بِالنَّجَاحِ. (tamatt'a bil-najah) - He enjoyed success.
الصَّدَاقَةُ تُعْطِي الحَيَاةَ مَعْنًى. (as-sadaqah tu'ti al-hayah ma'na) - Friendship gives life meaning.
تَقْدِيرُ الصَّدَاقَةِ أَمْرٌ هَامٌّ. (taqdir as-sadaqah amrun ham) - Valuing friendship is important.

when_to_say: When referring to written or verbal communication.
example: الرِّسَالَةُ وَصَلَتْ. (ar-risalah wasalat) - The message arrived.
كَتَبَ رِسَالَةً جَمِيلَةً. (kataba risalatan jameelah) - He wrote a beautiful message.

when_to_say: When discussing teamwork or mutual assistance.
example: التَّعَاوُنُ يُقَوِّي المَجْتَمَعَ. (at-ta'awun yuqawwi al-mujtama') - Cooperation strengthens the community.
دَعْوَةٌ إِلَى التَّعَاوُنِ. (da'wah ila at-ta'awun) - A call for cooperation.
الإِحْتِيَاجُ لِلْمَاءِ أَسَاسِيٌّ. (al-ihtiyaj lil-ma'i asasi) - The need for water is fundamental.
لَهُ إِحْتِيَاجَاتٌ كَثِيرَةٌ. (lahu ihtiyajat katheerah) - He has many needs.
الإِبْتِسَامَةُ تُسْعِدُ الآخَرِينَ. (al-ibtisamah tus'id al-akharin) - A smile makes others happy.
إِبْتَسَمَ لَهُ بِوُدٍّ. (ibtasama lahu biwudd) - He smiled at him warmly.
التَّطَوُّرُ يُحَسِّنُ الحَيَاةَ. (at-tatowur yuhassin al-hayah) - Development improves life.
يَحْدُثُ تَطَوُّرٌ فِي العِلْمِ. (yahduth tatowur fi al-ilm) - Development is happening in science.
المَسْؤُولِيَّةُ صِفَةٌ عَظِيمَةٌ. (al-mas'ooliyyah sifatun azeemah) - Responsibility is a great quality.
تَحَمَّلَ المَسْؤُولِيَّةَ بِشَجَاعَةٍ. (tahammala al-mas'ooliyyah bi-shaja'ah) - He took on responsibility courageously.
الحُبُّ يُلْهِمُ الحَيَاةَ. (al-hubb yulhim al-hayah) - Love inspires life.
أَظْهَرَ الحُبَّ بِكُلِّ صِدْقٍ. (az-hara al-hubb bi-kulli sidq) - He expressed love with full sincerity.
الصَّبْرُ يُؤَدِّي إِلَى النَّجَاحِ. (as-sabr yu'addi ila an-najah) - Patience leads to success.
تَعَلَّمَ الصَّبْرَ فِي الوَقْتِ الصَّعْبِ. (ta'allama as-sabr fi al-waqt as-sa'b) - He learned patience during difficult times.
الأَمَانُ أَمْرٌ هَامٌّ. (al-aman amrun ham) - Safety is important.
يَشْعُرُ بِالأَمَانِ. (yash'uru bil-aman) - He feels safe.
المَعْرِفَةُ تُفْتَحُ البَصِيرَةَ. (al-ma'rifah tuftah al-basirah) - Understanding opens the mind.
لَدَيْهِ مَعْرِفَةٌ جَيِّدَةٌ. (ladayhi ma'rifah jayyidah) - He has good understanding.
الفَرَحُ يُجْمِلُ الحَيَاةَ. (al-farah yujmil al-hayah) - Joy beautifies life.
شَعَرَ بِالفَرَحِ بَعْدَ النَّجَاحِ. (sha'ara bil-farah ba'd an-najah) - He felt joy after success.
التَّغْيِيرُ ضَرُورِيٌّ أَحْيَانًا. (at-taghyeer daruri ahyanan) - Change is sometimes necessary.
كَانَ تَغْيِيرًا إِيجَابِيًّا. (kana taghyeeran ijabiyyan) - It was a positive change.

when_to_say: When emphasizing compassion or human values.
example: الإِنسَانِيَّةُ أَسَاسُ العَالَمِ. (al-insaniyyah asas al-alam) - Humanity is the foundation of the world.
أَظْهَرَ الإِنسَانِيَّةَ فِي تَصَرُّفَاتِهِ. (azhara al-insaniyyah fi tasarufatihi) - He showed humanity in his actions.
لَدَيْهِ ذَاكِرَةٌ قَوِيَّةٌ. (ladayhi dhakirah qawiyyah) - He has a strong memory.
التَّدْرِيبُ يُحَسِّنُ الذَّاكرَةَ. (at-tadreeb yuhassin adh-dhakirah) - Practice improves memory.

when_to_say: When talking about learning or education.
example: العِلْمُ نُورٌ. (al-ilm nur) - Knowledge is light.
يَسْعَى لِلحُصُولِ عَلَى العِلْمِ. (yas'a lil-husool ala al-ilm) - He strives to gain knowledge.
الحُرِيَّةُ حَقٌّ لِكُلِّ إِنسَانٍ. (al-hurriyyah haqqun likulli insan) - Freedom is a right for every person.
يُدَافِعُ عَنْ حُرِيَتِهِ. (yudafi'u an hurriyyatihi) - He defends his freedom.
السَّعَادَةُ غَايَةٌ كُلِّ إِنسَانٍ. (as-sa'adah ghayah kull insan) - Happiness is the goal of every person.
شَعَرَ بِالسَّعَادَةِ بَيْنَ أَصْدِقَائِهِ. (sha'ara bis-sa'adah bayna asdiqa'ihi) - He felt happiness among his friends.
القُوَّةُ مَطْلُوبَةٌ فِي كُلِّ عَمَلٍ. (al-quwwah matloobah fi kull amal) - Strength is needed in every task.
أَظْهَرَ القُوَّةَ فِي الوَقْتِ الصَّعْبِ. (azhara al-quwwah fi al-waqt as-sa'b) - He showed strength during difficult times.
الأَمَلُ يُحْيِي النُّفُوسَ. (al-amal yuhyi an-nufus) - Hope revives the soul.
لَا تَفْقِدِ الأَمَلَ أَبَدًا. (la tafqid al-amal abadan) - Never lose hope.

when_to_say: When discussing teamwork or helping others.
example: التَّعَاوُنُ يُؤَدِّي إِلَى النَّجَاحِ. (at-ta'awun yu'addi ila an-najah) - Cooperation leads to success.
عَمِلُوا بِالتَّعَاوُنِ. (amiloo bi-ta'awun) - They worked with cooperation.
الصِّحَّةُ أَغْلَى مَا يَمْلِكُ الإِنسَانُ. (as-sihhah aghla ma yamliku al-insan) - Health is the most valuable thing a person owns.
يَحَافِظُ عَلَى صِحَّتِهِ. (yahafith ala sihhah-tihi) - He maintains his health.
التَّغْفِيرُ قُوَّةٌ. (at-taghfeer quwwah) - Forgiveness is strength.
طَلَبَ التَّغْفِيرَ مِنْ أَصْدِقَائِهِ. (talaba at-taghfeer min asdiqa'ihi) - He sought forgiveness from his friends.
النَّجَاحُ يُعْطِي الحَيَاةَ مَعْنًى. (an-najah yu'ti al-hayah ma'na) - Success gives life meaning.
عَمِلَ جَاهِدًا لِلنَّجَاحِ. (amila jahidan lin-najah) - He worked hard for success.
الصَّدَاقَةُ جَمِيلَةٌ. (as-sadaqah jameelah) - Friendship is beautiful.
قَدَّرَ الصَّدَاقَةَ كَثِيرًا. (qaddara as-sadaqah kathiran) - He valued friendship greatly.
الشَّجَاعَةُ تُقَوِّي النَّفْسَ. (ash-shaja'ah tuqawwi an-nafs) - Bravery strengthens the soul.
أَظْهَرَ شَجَاعَتَهُ فِي الوَقْتِ الصَّعْبِ. (azhara shaja'atahu fi al-waqt as-sa'b) - He showed his bravery during difficult times.
الطُّمَأْنِينَةُ تَأْتِي بِالصَّبْرِ. (at-tuma'neenah ta'ti bis-sabr) - Peace of mind comes with patience.
وَجَدَ الطُّمَأْنِينَةَ فِي صَلَاتِهِ. (wajada at-tuma'neenah fi salatihi) - He found peace of mind in his prayer.
النِّظَامُ يُحَقِّقُ النَّجَاحَ. (an-nizam yuhaqqiq an-najah) - Order brings success.
أَعْتَمِدُ عَلَى النِّظَامِ فِي عَمَلِي. (a'tamid ala an-nizam fi amali) - I rely on order in my work.

when_to_say: When emphasizing honesty or purity of intent.
example: الإِخْلَاصُ يُقَوِّي العَلَاقَاتِ. (al-ikhlas yuqawwi al-alaqat) - Sincerity strengthens relationships.
يَعْمَلُ بِإِخْلَاصٍ. (ya'mal bi-ikhlas) - He works sincerely.

when_to_say: When motivating persistence in the face of challenges.
example: المُثَابَرَةُ تُوصِلُ إِلَى القِمَّةِ. (al-muthabarah tuwasilu ila al-qimmah) - Perseverance leads to the top.
كَانَتْ مُثَابَرَتُهُ مَثَالًا يُحْتَذَى. (kanat muthabaratuhu mithalan yuhtadha) - His perseverance was exemplary.
الثِّقَةُ بِالنَّفْسِ مِفْتَاحُ النَّجَاحِ. (ath-thiqah bin-nafs miftah an-najah) - Self-confidence is the key to success.
يَتَحَدَّثُ بِثِقَةٍ. (yatahaddathu bi-thiqah) - He speaks with confidence.

when_to_say: When expressing gratitude or value for someone.
example: التَّقْدِيرُ يُعَزِّزُ العَلَاقَاتِ. (at-taqdir yu'azziz al-alaqat) - Appreciation strengthens relationships.
شَكَرَهُ عَلَى التَّقْدِيرِ. (shakarahu ala at-taqdir) - He thanked him for the appreciation.

when_to_say: When emphasizing courtesy or regard for others.
example: الإِحْتِرَامُ يَبْنِي الثِّقَةَ. (al-ihtiram yabni ath-thiqah) - Respect builds trust.
عَامَلَهُ بِكُلِّ إِحْتِرَامٍ. (a'amalahu bikulli ihtiram) - He treated him with all respect.

when_to_say: When admiring thoughtful decisions or insights.
example: الحِكْمَةُ تُوَجِّهُ الأُمُورَ. (al-hikmah tuwajihu al-umur) - Wisdom guides matters.
قَالَ كَلِمَةً بِكُلِّ حِكْمَةٍ. (qala kalimatan bikulli hikmah) - He spoke a word with all wisdom.
الرِّضَا يُقَرِّبُ القُلُوبَ. (ar-rida yuqarrib al-qulub) - Contentment brings hearts closer.
عَاشَ حَيَاتَهُ بِرِضَا. (a'asha hayatuhu birida) - He lived his life with contentment.
